meanings.definition: To protect or defend against harm or danger.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight was guarding the castle from intruders.
meanings.sent2: The security guard is always guarding the entrance to the building.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy dog thought he was guarding the house from squirrels.
meanings.sent4: The mother bird was guarding her nest with fierce determination.
meanings.sent5: The vigilant lifeguard was guarding the swimmers from any potential danger.

meanings.definition: The act of keeping watch over someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The guarding of the treasure was entrusted to the old pirate.
meanings.sent2: The guarding of the museum artifacts requires constant attention.
meanings.sent3: The little girl took her doll's guarding very seriously.
meanings.sent4: The guarding of the garden from pests was a daily task.
meanings.sent5: The guarding of the camp at night was a shared responsibility among the scouts.

meanings.definition: A person or group of people responsible for protecting someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The royal family's guarding was a team of skilled knights.
meanings.sent2: The guarding of the president involves highly trained secret service agents.
meanings.sent3: The guarding of the cookies from her little brother was a challenge for the girl.
meanings.sent4: The guarding of the ancient artifact was entrusted to a group of experts.
meanings.sent5: The guarding of the endangered species required the collaboration of conservationists and scientists.
